dialogues.text: And this is Doug Rosselli, does high-dollar theft cases for the poodle crowd. Your Picasso takes a trip, Doug'll find it or die trying. Doug stares at Jake like he's a bug as they shake. Jake withers a little. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you, sir. Lou takes Alonzo's arm.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Have a seat, guy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alonzo slides into a leather chair at their table.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Shoo, boy. Shoo. He points out the corner table for Jake. Jake crosses, sits, his back to their table.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Seems like a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Why the long face, Doug? Feds seize your house or something? Chuckles from Lou and Stan.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Spent twelve months trying to catch this serial burglar. A real slickster, gave up nothing. Captain rode my ass the entire time. What broke it? Luck. Caught in the act by a patrolman. We had him. Prosecutor's first major case but he slam-dunked it. From a stepladder. Jury deliberates half a day. Comes back guilty on ten out of eleven counts. The shitbag was looking at a twenty-five minimum.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Minimum. Bye-bye, toilet-licker.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Sentencing was today --

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: -- Judge is female.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Right. Landers.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I know her. Sharp lady.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Before this guy goes to the hearing, he gets a hold of some peanut butter and packs his ass crack with it. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alonzo is

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: laughing t Laughs. 67.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Before the arraignment hearing today, the guy gets a hold of some peanut butter and packs his ass crack with it. He's standing tall before the bench to give his statement, shoves his hand down his pants and comes out with a gob of fuckin' extra-chunky Jiff. Coulda heard a pin drop. Bailiffs wouldn't come near him. He looks the judge right in her eyes and licks his fingers clean. Holy shit. The judge, she screams. All these homeowners are there to read statements, they run out screaming. breaking up. Stan and Lou too. OO.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: No wait, here's the punchline. Judge orders him to psychiatric.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Fucker'1l do six months in the puzzle factory before they say he's normal and kick him loose.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Won't do a day in prison.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: If the asshole's clever enough to play the system like that, I say he earned his freedom.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I see him on the street, I'm gonna fuckin' do him.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Take his bullets, Stan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, been showing my new guy around town. Scored some reefer for him to smoke. But he wouldn't. So I run through the whole bit, the gun to the head. Everything. 'Okay,' he says. I light up and it stinks like burnt rubber, right? Nevertheless, I pass it to him. The detectives grin knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kid's gotta learn.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: We're in MacArthur Park and he starts screaming and jumps out of my car. The detectives are hooked. So is...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Listening, sipping water.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: So I chase him down this alley and, holy shit, he's jamming two huge crackheads and there's this mamacita with a bloody nose. Kid stopped a rape.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Kid's got a magic eye.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: That's what I told him. Kid's a prince. Jake beams with beer-buzzed pride. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: His first day on the squad and know what he tells me? (pathetic voice) "You're a rogue cop.' Roars of laughter from the Detectives.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: He turns, sees it's a serious pow-wow. Overhears:

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Heard you had an expensive weekend in Vegas. How'd you screw up so bad?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: How could I know? Vegas ain't my town. I'm not omniscient.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: You should hop a jet outta here.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Why? It's an easy fix.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I can cash out an account.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: One of mine. My first. The three suits shudder, trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: You're messed up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: He's a security risk. Who's gonna keep him off the radar if I'm gone. You? I'm taxing him. A beat. Stan acquiesces.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: It's your call. Do not dick this up. I do not want you on the front page with the rest of those assholes. Alonzo smiles. And the men speak in hushed tones. Jake turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, Doug, Stan and Alonzo stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jake snaps his eyes to his plate. The men murmur. The Waiter arrives with Jake's steak.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: You should know when not to listen. Jake reacts. The Waiter quickly exits. Jake looks at his steak. Pushes away the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo and Jake exit. It's obvious something big is going down. Alonzo is excited, happy, the raid jacket underarm. He crosses to the valet.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Gimme the keys for the grey one. Alonzo receives a key ring. Alonzo crosses to one of three plush unmarked police sedans in the lot. Jake watches him open the trunk and empty his jacket inside. Alonzo returns the keys to the valet.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 48
dialogues.text: Alonzo drives away. Dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: It's me. We gotta green light. Fax the warrant to the clerk and tell her to get the judge to sign it. I want you and Paul to bring it to location one. Have Jeff get some picks and shovels. Sign 'em out from maintenance. Copy that? (beat) Good. Hurry up. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: How much was in your jacket?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Forty G's.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You wanna know?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Nothing's free in this world. Not even an arrest warrant. Jake didn't want to know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Who's it for?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: A real bag of shit. A genuine bad guy. Been investigating this vile bastard for ten years. He's a big fish in a big pond. Today I fry him. The squad's gonna get some glory. Talkin' name-making shit. We'll be getting handshakes from the Chief and Mayor. Wanna piece, new guy? A beat. Jake smiles. Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. I wanna piece.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near downtown. An unmarked police sedan waits. The G-Ride parks next to it. Alonzo and Jake exit. Out of the sedan steps MARK, a Chicano clothes horse in Italian silk. And PAUL, a steely-eyed, heavyset black guy. JEFF and TIM exit, clean-cut white guys, Jeff has a mullet. Tim is generic but tough-looking.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Nice suit, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Beautiful suit. Now Alonzo and Jake get out. Six cops huddled in an alley. Jake fits right in with the motley bunch. Mark hands Alonzo the warrant.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Thanks. (to Jeff and Tim) My picks and shovels?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: In the trunk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Gonna dig a ditch?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You are. Great suit.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (shakes with Paul) Howdy, killer.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Alonzo, what the hell's going on? I've been hearing things. You good?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I talked to the three wise men. It's all good. His men trade looks, they have total trust in him. Jake is a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You say we get away with it, let's hit this fool -- Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Jake Hoyt. First day in the unit. I'm coming from Valley patrol. He holds out his hand. Paul scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You're a long way from Starbucks. (to Alonzo) Why's he in on this shit?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Gotta pop his cherry sometime.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (to Jake; peeved) Stay the hell outta my way, little puppy. This is big dog work. Alonzo notes Jake's unease, shows him the warrant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: It's the real deal. Signed by the judge. Thank the Sandman. (addresses everyone) Our safety comes first. He gives us shit, we give him lead. Let's do this right so everyone can go home and do the wife and girl friend thing tonight. (checks his watch) Suit up, ladies. Time to punch in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five cops crouch outside a gate with shotguns, MP-5s. Assault vests and helmets worn over civvies. Jake and Jeff to one side. Paul, Mark and Tim to the other. Alonzo crosses to the gate with boltcutters and snaps the padlock. The five cops open the gate and run to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door of the little house. Paul and Mark kick it open. Wood splinters. The five cops rush inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops run through the kitchen into a familiar living room. A familiar one -- This is Roger's house. Jake is surprised, confused. Roger reads on the couch, the morning paper. He's nonplussed to find himself surrounded by police, weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Freeze up! You need to not move, breathe, think or blink.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: What are you clowns doing here?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Shut up! -- New guy! His hands move, blast him. Jake aiming his shotgun at Roger's head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm on him. Roger, holding his newspaper, recognizes Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: You know what you're doing, son? Jake nods: yes. The truth is; he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Drop what's in your hands. Before zero. Five. Four. Three. Two. CLUNK-CLUNK! Two tiny derringers hit the coffee table. Roger had been palming them. Paul sweeps them aside with his foot. The cops relax a little. Roger folds his paper. Sets it down, takes off his reading glasses. A principal besieged by truants.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Alonzo's gonna kill you guys. Alonzo enters the shattered door. Holding picks, shovels. He drops the tools. They crash to the floor. Roger crosses his arms and glares at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: What's going down, Alonzo?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I had lunch with the three wise men. You gotta render unto Caesar. Roger sees the tools and knows exactly what they are for.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Those goddamn vampires want my pension.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: No, man, it's not like that. You're just getting taxed. They got their boat payments and God knows what. I'm sorry. They're makin' me do it. I'm just a lowly civil servant.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You're their bitch. What happens with me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Don't worry, bro. I promised you'd never go back to prison. I got your back. You won't even miss what I'm gonna take. I hate doing this. Orders is orders. Sorry, dog.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: No, you ain't. Cop.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (to Tim and Jeff) You guys are gonna work. Get the tools. (grabs Jake's shotgun) Gimme the boomer. Tim and Jeff gather the tools. Alonzo hands Jake a pick and leads the three men to the kitchen. Roger pours a slug of Crown Royal as Paul and Mark guard him.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Who's paying for my floor?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: The city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo flips the table. Taps the floor with his toe.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Open the floor. Right here. Jake, Tim and Jeff begin chopping. It's quick work to tear a large hole in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Hop in, Hoyt. Couple a feet down, there's a locker. Jake jumps in. Attacking dirt with his pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Tim and Jeff haul a trash-bag-wrapped footlocker out of the hole. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Open it. Jake tears away trash bags. Alonzo takes a pick and snaps the lock. Jake opens the lid -- taped bundles inside.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's coke? Alonzo hands him a penknife.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Cut the damn thing open. Jake does -- it is a brick of fifty dollar bills. Alonzo is relieved to see the money. Jake likes its heft.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: This is sweet.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: That's a hundred grand in your hot little hands. There's four million bucks in there. Alonzo slaps Jake's back.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: First day on the job and you're in on a three million dollar seizure.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You said four.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Told you, nothing's for free. Gotta grease the rails to make the big moves. Alonzo grabs a shopping bag. Tosses bricks of fifties in it. Hands it to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Here. Lucky to get this, day-one- motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What's this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Sweet green clean legal tender. Start the kid's college fund early. Get the old lady a minivan. However pleasant the heft, Jake could never accept. He returns the shopping bag to Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No way. Only checks I cash say City of L.A. on ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Someone didn't sleep through Ethics.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You said you wanted a piece.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Not like this.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I understand. I'1l hold on to it for you. Not everyone's comfortable the first time -- Let's wrap up. Alonzo drops the bag in the locker. Exits. Jake, Tim and Jeff follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger reads a Vegas odds paper. Alonzo, Tim, Jeff and Jake enter. Roger glares at Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: What have I done to those guys? Are they nuts? Am I supposed to stand still and let them horsefuck me?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: No. We can put you out of your misery. Alonzo tosses Jake the shotgun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you a secret, Hoyt. If you kill someone on duty, they have to be your slave in the afterlife. (points to Roger) There you go. Start an entourage.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You want me to shoot him? Paul, Mark, Tim and Jeff snicker, crack smiles. Roger too. Jake plays along, points the shotgun at Roger.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: You'd be doin' me a favor, kid.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Bang -- There. He lowers the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Not gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Of course not. This isn't funny. Alonzo smiles. Takes the shotgun from him.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Man, youngsters these days. Can't get shit done unless you do it yourself. Alonzo aims at Roger. Roger suddenly understands.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: This is all you... BOOM! Roger is punched ragged with BUCKSHOT, lifted off his couch, knocked into the wall. Jake jumps back. A peal of laughter from Tim. Contagious giggles from the others. Roger gurgles. Jake stares wide-eyed at Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Jake's shock elicits more giggles from the squad.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Finish him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake watches Alonzo cross to Roger, blindly gasping.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: He's finished. Alonzo takes one of Roger's derringers from the floor. Slaps it in the dying man's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: C'mere, Jeff. You took fire coming through the door. Jeff smiles, gets in position so Alonzo can shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Alright. Gonna get some time off. He braces himself. Alonzo aims Roger's hand. Pop! A BULLET THWACKS harmlessly into Jeff's VEST. He removes his sunglasses from a pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Watch my shades. Jake looking at Roger, it's hard to watch a man die. Again Jeff braces. Pop! The THWACK of another BULLET.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: How's that? Jeff probing his hand under the vest.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Fine. Alonzo drops the gun in an envelope marked: EVIDENCE HANDGUN. Jake can't believe what he just saw.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Listen up. This is the scenario. Mark and Paul kick the door. Jeff is first through. Roger opens fire. Hits Jeff twice. Jeff coughs -- bright foamy blood in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: One go through? Jeff answers by coughing more blood. Tim runs to him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Siddown, dude. Jeff does. Tim opens the vest -- a hole in a seam on the edge. Underneath, bruised puckered flesh drools blood.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: You shot him!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You shot me!

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Call a rescue.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You're fine. You'll get a medal.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Call the R.A.!

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Let me quarterback the goings on and I will. Okay -- Mark and Paul kick the door. First through is Jeff. Bang. Bang. Gets hit. Wounded. Second through is our new guy, Hoyt. He drops the suspect with some fine shotgun work. (points at Mark) Who shot Roger?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: The new guy. Came in spraying.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Paul?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The boot shot him.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: What'd you guys see?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Hoyt blasted him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hoyt went for it -- Now will you get me a damn rescue ambulance? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake looks at these guys. They look back, smiling, smirking. He feels dizzy, sick as the nightmare sinks in. Jeff coughs blood. Alonzo tosses his rover to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (into rover) Eleven forty-nine. Nine-nine- eight. Shots fired. Shots fired. Officer down. Fifty-nine fifty- one Baxter Street.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (slaps Jake's back) Good job, son. Congratulations. Gonna get a medal of valor.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: «+. I didn't shoot him...

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Roomful of cops says you did.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I don't care. I didn't shoot him. You did. Alonzo pulls his gun. Aims at Jake's face.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (as a newscaster) A Los Angeles Police Department narcotics officer was killed serving a high risk warrant in Echo Park today. An L.A.P.D. spokesperson said the young officer was survived by his wife and infant child. (himself) Shit gets deeper. Get the picture?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I got the picture. Jake strikes -- twists back Alonzo's gun sharply -- sweeps away his legs with a kick. Alonzo finds himself on his back, Jake's knee on his neck, staring down the maw of his own pistol. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That's the second time you've stuck a gun in my face. Won't be a third.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. You guys watching this? That's it, Jake. Paul presses his Beretta against Jake's temple.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Be my pleasure putting a hydrashock in your melon. Tim, Jeff, Mark gawk at the Mexican standoff.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: But I'm gonna be cool. Open your hand slowly. Drop the weapon. Jake's free hand inches to his holstered gun --

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (super-calm) Hey, sorry, man. Relax, okay? -- and snatches it -- He swings on Tim -- who swings his -45 on Jake. A three-way standoff.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Wanna shoot me, Paul? Go ahead. Because these two are gonna be wiping my ass in the netherworld. A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Alonzo. This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: This dude's a fed.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: He's no fed. Just a choirboy with heart who got the drop on you fools. Everyone, let's take a deep breath and defuse this -- Jake? You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You can't just spring this shit on me. I never signed up for this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I hear you. I know you're angry!-- Paul, Tim, please put down your guns.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Hell no.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Choirboy first. SIRENS APPROACH. Lots of them.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Both of you: guns down. Now. Paul and Tim reluctantly lower their weapons. Jake lifts his knee off Alonzo's neck, stands and backs away, aiming both pistols at Alonzo, who climbs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Jake, use your ears and listen. Sometimes we take shit all the way. That's the nature of the game. We don't do this every day. No one will ever again ask you to pull a trigger you don't want to!-- Mark, where're you transferring to?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Westside Homicide.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Westside Homicide -- Just made detective. Jake, give me eighteen months and I'll give you a career. We make the big arrests. We make the big seizures. When someone's in my unit they're in all the way or not at all. I thought you were man enough to handle this shit. Alonzo calmly pours himself a glass of Roger's whisky.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Five proven, decorated officers say you were the shooter. Investigators are gonna pull a tube of your blood and test for intoxicants. Remember all the P.C.P. you smoked today? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake does, wincing at his stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You've been planning this all day.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I've been planning this all week. You start talking crazy shit, I will make sure your dirty blood makes it to the lab. Still wanna walk your babynuts around the block? You won't make it to the corner. But if you're cool. You're a hero. A virgin shooter above suspicion. Jake looks at Roger, gasping like a beached carp. The SIRENS are getting CLOSER. Alonzo gulps his drink and!-- Pfffffst! Spits the booze in Jake's face. Jake is blinded. Paul seizes Jake's wrists and aims the pistols at the ceiling. Alonzo wrenches the pistols from his hands. Jake wipes his eyes, looks at the roomful of crazy cops, scared. Paul points at Roger's other derringer, laying on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Alonzo, there's two shots in that stinger. Let's kill your boy right now and say Roger dumped him coming through the door. Mark, Tim, Jeff like the idea. Jake doesn't. And lucky for him, neither does Alonzo, who stands protectively in front of Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: No. We're not killing him. He's a good guy. Man's got the magic. Just having a little freakout is all. We've all been there. I say he's cool. No one's gonna hurt him. Jake and Alonzo trade a look. The SIRENS are close.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Hoyt, you gotta decision to make. In ten seconds, this place will be overrun with blue suits. Go outside and clear your head. (returns Jake's gun) Or shoot me now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake is only too happy to get out of there. Jake crosses to exit, pauses, an afterthought:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Paul. Crack! Jake nails his jaw. Paul staggers, almost falls. To Jake as he exits:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You're dead! I'm takin' you out. I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Kick back, Wyatt Earp. Gotta respect a cat who puts you on queer street with one punch. (catches his men trading looks) Kid's got more balls than all you faggots combined.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 56
dialogues.text: from a distant hilltop. The ambulances and black and whites out front shimmer in golden afternoon heat. Two distance-distorted LAPD paramedics wheel out Roger on a stretcher. ZOOM IN. Amidst the heat mirages, Alonzo talks to a uniformed sergeant. Two more paramedics wheel Jeff outside on a stretcher. Mark, Tim and Paul following. Roger is lifted into an ambulance. Alonzo dismisses Jeff's paramedics and huddles with his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo crosses to the G-ride with an armload of gear. Pops the trunk. Dumps everything inside. He shuts the trunk. Dials his cell phone and gets in the car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: leaning against a phone pole. Watching as Alonzo pulls a clipboard from under his seat and puts on reading glasses. Alonzo begins writing a major incident report as he talks on his cell. A beat. Alonzo STARTS the G-RIDE. Motions for Jake to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gets in, on the verge of freaking out. Alonzo with his reading glasses, the clipboard on his steering wheel, filling in the report, talking on his cell phone, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: -- you're gonna be scrubbing the bathtub, homie. Later. Alonzo hangs up. Preoccupied with filling in little boxes on the report.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Why didn't you take off?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: There's nowhere to run.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Roger was D.O.A. at Good Samaritan. Let's get the paper rolling now. Alonzo looks at Jake, sees his torment.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Justifiable homicide in the line of duty. Anyone'd be proud to have that in their jacket.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Not this way. Say I don't play along?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: At this point it behooves you not to dick around. Jake has a lump in his throat. A beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: What happened today was -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: -- was murder and armed robbery. Wait. We had badges. It's different.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Dammit, boy! Why can't you open your eyes and see? Jake can see. Too clearly. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That man was your friend and you killed him like a fly.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Friend? Because I drank his whisky and he knew my name? Shit. I was playing his ass. That's my job. That's your job. Roger sold dope to kids. World's better off without him. He's the biggest major violator in L.A. I've been watching the cocksucker operate with impunity for ten years. Now I got him. This shit's chess not checkers. Can't just slap cuffs on a cat like that. That's the truth. And Jake knows it.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Look, keep the money.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Told you, I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Just take it. Throw it in the ocean. Barbecue it. Just take it. It would make the boys feel better.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck their feelings.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You're not making anyone feel you're on the team. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The team? You guys are insane. I'll go back to Valley and cut parking tickets. Jake stares out the window a beat, clenching his jaw. He looks at dozens of birds sitting on the power lines, backlit by the setting sun. Jake finally looks at Alonzo, stares into Alonzo's scary, empty eyes. Amazed to be utterly trapped by them. We can almost hear Jake's heart breaking.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It can't be like this. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: It is like this. I'm really sorry I exposed you to all that. It was ugly but it was necessary. Never seen no one die before? Too damn soft. Bet you never missed a meal in your life.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (glares at Alonzo) Missed a lot meals growing up. Why? (pantomimes shooting up) Because the folks had to do their shit. OFF Alonzo's amazed look:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That's right. I'm in the cop business to lock up the criminals, the poisoners. Not to be one. Alonzo sizes up Jake anew, laments not knowing that earlier. He tries a different tack.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: All the shit you're feeling now, it's going to go away. I know you're scared.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm not scared. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: You're terrified. I know you are. I went through the same shit. Everyone has. Sooner the world in your head matches the real world, the better you're gonna feel. (a beat) Jake, there's gotta be dirt on you if anyone's gonna trust you. After this is behind you, a whole new life will open up. I walk a higher path. I can give you the keys to all doors.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: I'm not the asskicker I once was, but you are. Want to run my unit? My guys are good but not one of those clowns is a leader. You are. Want my job? You got it. Wanna lock up criminals? This is the best place to do it. Do your time and make detective. Play the game, grow wise and change things from the inside. Jake looks at him. And realizes Alonzo is right. Alonzo STARTS the CAR, exits the alley.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Let's get to the hospital and talk to Stan. He'll tell you what to say to the D.A.'s guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-ride crosses the river into East L.A. General Hospital looms ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tough old barrio is before the huge hospital. Cholos drink on the sidewalk. Play grab-ass and listen to MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: SUNSET 61
dialogues.text: Alonzo parks near the gangsters.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What's here?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Informant of mine's in Chino. Promised I'd help out his family. Alonzo points out a well-tended, quiet, quaint house near the cholos. Alonzo gets out. Opens the trunk. Loads up his arms with appliances.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Sometimes I bring food. Believe it or not, I like to help out the community whenever I can. (a box falls) Shit. Hoyt, help me with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gets out, takes some boxes. And they cross to the house. With Jake following. Past staring cholos.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (re: Jake) He's with me. A drunk PeeWee maddogs Jake. Jake maddogs back.

dialogues.speaker: PEEWEE
dialogues.text: You know where you're at, fool? A VETERANO shoves the PeeWee aside.

dialogues.speaker: VETERANO
dialogues.text: Outta the way, punk. It's business. He shakes with Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: VETERANO
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, dog. Thought you were missing in action.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, man. You know I'm never lost.  63 64 65 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Alonzo cross to the house. AD LIBS of "Those're cops," spread through the cholos. At the house's door, Alonzo knocks. A beat. A little girl cracks it.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Hi. Got some stuff for your family. She closes it. A beat. The door opens to reveal SMILEY, a huge, drunk veterano sleeved with prison tattoos. He looks at the two cops. Massive, impassive. Smiley never smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Kitchen's this way. Alonzo enters. Jake hesitates. Then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl does homework on a computer. Two fine cholas watch the Spanish newscast. An old man dozes ina chair. Family photos on the wall -- A proud line of warfighters, lots of military uniforms. Alonzo and Jake follow Smiley into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER and MORENO, big and intimidating like Smiley, have been playing poker around a beer-bottle-covered table. Smiley, Alonzo and Jake enter.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Put it on the counter. Alonzo and Jake place the boxes on the counter. Sniper, Moreno, ignore Alonzo. And vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Can I use the head?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (to Jake) I'll be two seconds. We're already late. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alonzo exits to a hallway. Smiley opens a box. Pulls out a nice CD player.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: That's nice. Lemme get that.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You get the blender. This is mine. Smiley opens a microwave box. Jake reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box contains the bag of cash Jake refused.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Dreamer! Got your bony ass in here! DREAMER, 19, an attractive young lady, enters. Smiley hands her the bag of Jake's money.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Count that shit in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DREAMER
dialogues.text: Thanks, eh. I was doing stuff. You learn to count, math whiz. She gives him a dirty look and exits. Smiley takes his seat and picks up his cards. He eyes Moreno.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: You looked at ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: No I didn't. Smiley tosses them to Sniper.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Deal again.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Play cards, cop?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Not really. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Beer? Moreno offers one. Sniper deals in Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: C'mon and play a hand.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Don't be rude, dude. One hand.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it. We ain't playin' for money.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Alonzo's taking a dump. Go ahead and have a seat. Sniper finishes dealing. Jake looks at the cards intended for him.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Okay. One hand. Jake sits. Now he can see a shotgun against the wall by Moreno. The three cholos check their hands, signal for more cards. Jake checks his cards.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: How long you been a cop?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Nineteen months.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Like it?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I shoulda been a fireman.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Waddaya got, dog?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Your hand, homes. Oh -- Jake lays down his cards.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Three of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Man... didn't get squat. He tosses away his hand, Moreno, too. Sniper shows his cards with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Two pair. Sniper collects the cards. Shuffles.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The cop won.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: I got two pair.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Three of a kind beats two pair, dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: See why we don't play for money? Moreno shakes his head, points at Jake's waist.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Lemme see your cohete.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Your gun, dude. Let him see your gun. Under your shirt. Jake is outnumbered, outsized, outgunned. All he can do is take the pistol from his holster and show Moreno.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: That's down. What is it? A three eighty?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Three eighty stainless. Double action. Nine round mag. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Lemme see it. Ain't gonna blast no one. Jake hands it over. Moreno examines it with skilled hands.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Fuck a vato up with this. He hands it back. To Jake's relief. Jake looks down the hall. Getting up:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: We have to go. I'm gonna get Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Kick back and party. Smiley pulls aside the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty street. The G-Ride is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ain't nobody out there for you.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: He feels like a toddler lost in a department store. He sits back down. Moreno laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Alonzo played you like a booger. Smiley slides the deck to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Your deal. Jake shuffles. Smiley lights a joint. Offers it to him.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: It's P.C.P. Wanna hit?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No thanks. I already smoked out today. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Shit. I'll step on that P-dog. Sniper takes it, inhales. Jake dealing cards. The joint rounds the table. Jake does.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Gimme two cards. Dreamer enters.

dialogues.speaker: DREAMER
dialogues.text: It's all there.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: DREAMER
dialogues.text: You count it if you don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks -- Gimme three. Dreamer grabs a beer and exits. Jake deals three.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Alonzo pulled off a miracle, huh? Times are tight. Scared up a lotta cash.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Who'd he jack?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (dealing cards) I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: He jacked Roger. Blasted the dude. Moreno guffaws. Sniper chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Damnnnn. Alonzo's scandalous.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: That's some cold shit. Vato'll jack anyone.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Alonzo's a low-down, dirty, ruthless vato. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: That's why I never shake his hand. He don't respect shit. (to Jake) Know what the money's for?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Alonzo's a hothead. Last week in Vegas some Russian dude was talking shit. Alonzo spazzed out and beat his ass to death. Oops. Turns out the dude was somebody. Alonzo's into the Rooskies for million, wasting that cat like that.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: How do you know? Smiley gives Jake a look.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: They gave Alonzo till today to pay up. But his name's already on a list. No one thought he could get cash that big. Good thing he got his blood money, ‘cause a crew's waiting on standby. He don't get downtown and pay up by midnight and not a minute after, Cinderfella turns into a corpse.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: It's all about punctuality, ese.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Dude made a pact with the devil or some shit 'cause only a miracle coulda saved his ass.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's no miracle.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Alonzo takes care of business.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Cops get crafty in a clinch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: And get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Makes me wanna turn out a cop -- Ever had your shit pushed in?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: I had my shit pushed in.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Me too. My shit's been pushed in. Smiley?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (grins) I'm always gettin' love from the homies. Smiley caresses Jake's thigh under the table. He almost leaps from his chair. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Jumpy motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: (disgusted) He's a buster.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: You never been booty-busted? Jake tries to laugh. But it's getting weird.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Hey, cop. Win this hand and we won't bust you out.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Unless you want us to. Laughs. Sniper reveals his cards.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: I got two pair again.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: (tossing his cards) Didn't get shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (grins) Gotta straight.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. This jura's gonna be wearin' a dress. Everyone looks at Jake -- Well? He lays down his cards.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Full house.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: You won. Deal again. Smiley taps the deck. Jake looks at it. At them.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Deal, homie. Jake picks up the deck. Starts dealing. Smiley arranges his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Gimme three.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Fuck this buster. Let's get this shit over with. Looks of agreement are traded. Moreno grins at his shotgun. Sniper shifts his weight. Smiley whiteknuckling his beer.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Hurry up, cop. Gimme three. Jake reaches for the deck. This happens fast: Jake flings the deck in Sniper's face. Smack! Cards scatter. Jumps up from his chair, flips the table into Moreno. Smiley SMASHES a beer BOTTLE on Jake's head. Moreno grabbing the shotgun. Crack! -- Jake socks Smiley's jaw. He goes down, amazed to find himself on his ass. Crack! -- Sniper uppercuts Jake. Smiley grabs Jake's legs, yanks him to the deck -- kerchack! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bore of a 12 gauge and Moreno's leering face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jake gives up, his broken scalp gushing blood.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: ++. uncle... Dreamer pops her head in.

dialogues.speaker: DREAMER
dialogues.text: Dang! You guys fucked him up.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Get outta here. Take the girls next door. Or you're next. She gives him the finger, pops out. Smiley pats Jake down. Pockets his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You tripped, fool. You know that. He finds Jake's handcuffs -- clicks his wrists together behind his back. He takes his badge, clips it on his belt.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Look. I'm acop. Gonna start taxing. Smiley commences kicking the hell out of Jake:

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. For being a cop. For being a buster. For dogging me in the mouth in my own pad. And for bleeding on my clean kitchen floor. You have the right to be kicked. And the right to be slapped. Smack! He slaps him. Everyone laughs. Smiley finishes, panting.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: There. Get him in the bathtub. Moreno grabs Jake's hair, Sniper grabs an arm, they jerk him to his feet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Gotta fuck this vato up. They run him out of the kitchen, Smiley follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink carpet and porcelain kitties. They throw Jake into the tub -- shove his face in the drain. Smiley turns on the water -- Jake's blood whirlpooling away. Smiley grabs the shotgun from Moreno. Thumps the butt against Jake's head, flips it, shoves the muzzle in his ear. Snicks the shower curtain shut to catch the spatter.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Do it, eh.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be loud. Close the door. Moreno does. Sniper plugs his ears. Smiley braces for the recoil. Jake is dazed, like steer ina slaughterhouse chute.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Wait. Lemme get his money first. Smiley nods. Moreno searches Jake's pockets, takes his wallet. Pockets forty bucks. Finds the Schoolgirl's pink change purse. Opens it, reacts.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: «.. dang... He hands it to Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Here, ese... You are gonna trip out. Smiley opens it. His face goes dead blank. He hands Moreno the shotgun. Whips aside the shower curtain. Starts slugging Jake. Emphasizes each word with a kidney punch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Pinchi... game... playing... cop... where'd. you... get... this?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Get what? Get what? Oh, God. Smiley slaps him with the change purse.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: This, stupid. Alonzo give it to you?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No! I found it!

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: MacArthur Park!

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: What? Bullshit! The curtain closes. Smiley takes the shotgun. Holds it to Jake's temple. Moreno angles for a peek.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Wait up. I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: If you're religious, go ahead and get in that last prayer.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (sobs ) Omigod... she was going to be raped. I was driving with Alonzo. These two crackheads were gonna rape her. I saw them hit her. I stopped them. They were gonna rape her. I swear to God. I stopped it... I gotta kid --

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: -- Shut up, faggot! Smiley opens the curtain -- stomps Jake's back -- closes

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Blast the fool. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smiley aims, braces for the recoil. Jake croaks:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: -+- I gotta little girl... Smiley pauses. He eases off the trigger. Pulls a cell phone. Dials.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: We're gonna get to the bottom of your bullshit. She's my cousin. She's a civilian. Ain't right involving her. He sits on the toilet. Still holding the shotgun to Jake's head, he waits for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Schoolgirl works out Algebra II proofs on a "Hello Kitty" bedspread in a pink T-shirt. Boy band posters. She grabs her RINGING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOLGIRL
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Wassup, Letty. Whatcha doin'?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY, (SCHOOLGIRL)
dialogues.text: Hey, Smiley! Just here doing homework. Wanna talk to Tony?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: No. I wanna talk to you. Go to school today?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Yep. Yep.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: All day? You didn't ditch?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Nope. I went to every class... Why?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: I heard different. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat. 105. 69

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Cops talk to you today?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened. Don't bullshit me.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: I got jumped by two niggers.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You got jumped?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Well... I think they wanted to rape me. I kinda got hit. I mean he just slapped me. But nothing happened, okay? 'Cause this cop came and kicked their butts. They almost killed him but he kicked their asses.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: What did this cop look like?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: He was a white boy. He looked young. Smiley looks at Jake. That's him.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: That don't sound like nothing. Wanna go to the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: No. I said I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Letty. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: What were you doing in East Los?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: I was just kicking back at my friend's pad. There weren't no guys or nothing. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Letty.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You go there again, I'm gonna beat your ass. I got your bus pass and I.D. Gonna send 'em over. And we're gonna talk more about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Looks at Jake a long beat. Soaked, bloody, shivering. Click. He safeties the shotgun. Tosses it to a disappointed Moreno.

dialogues.speaker: MORENO
dialogues.text: Ain't you gonna blast him?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: The vato was tellin' the truth. Life's a trip, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: This is some trippy-ass shit. Smiley hands the change purse to Sniper.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Get this to Letty. Smiley stands, turns off the water. He helps Jake to his feet. Unlocks the handcuffs as Jake sways, woozy.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting my cousin's back. Jake half-smiles, not really sure if he's alive or not. Smiley tosses him a towel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Put that on your head. You're gonna stain the carpet. Where they at? Where you book ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Alonzo let them go. Smiley scowls. Regards Jake a beat, the wheels turning, Smiley's a smart guy. He offers Jake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You know this shit was just business.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I know. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Jake exit, the Cholos on the street, they watc him with their jaded, curious eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Alonzo wants your ass destroyed. Supposed to burn you up on the freeway by your house. Jake looks at Smiley. Sucks some blood from his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: You went Sega today, rookie. You're at that next level. Just play their games and do what you gotta do and you'll be cool. They'll make you Chief. He trades a look with Smiley and walks toward the nearby boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Sure you don't wanna ride? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I'm sure. Smiley watching him go, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (beat) Hey, cop! Jake stops, turns. Smiley smiles. The first time.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Remember me. Jake looks at Smiley, grins at the absurdity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver hits the button and the door opens. Jake climbs aboard; the driver is looking at his battered face Jake taps the badge on his belt. Pulls sixty bucks from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I need one of your shoes. The driver gives him a look, unties her shoe. Hands it to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Go straight to the Jungle. Stop only when I say. Cool. Jake jerks his head -- "Hurry up." He picked the right driver; her sock-clad foot stomps the gas pedal. The bus lurches forward. The bus drives away under Jake's walking feet. He turns and is scooped right into the back seat. Jake's ridden a lot of busses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls his gun. Gives it a quick function check. He pulls the shoelace from the shoe. Ties the gun to his hand. Jake catches his reflection in the window, contemplates himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered stranger. His reflection moving across the streetlife in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city bus FILLS FRAME. Then pulls away to reveal Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the block is the cul-de-sac. No man's land. Quiet and dark, the streetlights have been shot out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake enters, wary. He rounds the misparked van. The G-ride parked in a grassy lot. Jake glimpses the Little Kid on the bike disappear down a driveway. Jake notes a glowing cigarette on an apartment rooftop. Across the street, Jake sees rooftop movement, as someone takes cove CLICK-CLACK as a rooftop shadow cocks a RIFLE. Jake is on a mission, undeterred.

dialogues.speaker: ON HOUSE
dialogues.text: A porchlight turns off. The curtain moves in the window.

dialogues.speaker: COUPLE G'S
dialogues.text: kick it on a wall. Veteran soldiers ready for anything. They watch Jake pass with tough stoic faces. Jake continues toward Sara's building. Where a GANGSTER stands with crossed arms, Jake's an irritant, not a threa

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTER
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, rookie. You got business here? Jake looks up at Sara's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm here for Alonzo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Gangster opens the gate for him. Jake climbs the stairs to Sara's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is ON in the living room. Sara's boy plays on the floor. TAPPING AT the WINDOW. The boy sees it's Jake, who smiles, points at the door. The little boy crosses, unlocks the door. Jake enters quickly, grabs the boy and hides him in a bookcase with little doors at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Shhh. It's okay. Lay down. The boy looking at Jake as he closes the door. Jake hears GIGGLING 0.S. Crosses to the bedroom door. Wham! Jake kicks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake barges through the door, gun ready. Sara jumps from the bed, clutching a sheet. Alonzo is dressed down, ready for his important rendezvous. Finishing counting and repacking Roger's money into a war bag of police gear Twenty-two pounds worth of Benjamin Franklin. Alonzo spins, reacting as he recognizes the ghost before him. He raises his hands, impressed. Unable to reach his gun sitting on the dresser by his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Smiley didn't want the job.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Jake. Lemme shake your hand. You did it, you passed the test. You a man now. Alonzo offers his hand. Jake scoffs. Alonzo reaches for the war bag. Real slow. He fishes a smoke from the pack inside. Lights it.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Shit I've been through. Shit I've seen. Took me a long time to get where you are. Now you on, Jake. Now you're a real narc. I held your hand through hell. You just gonna stand there holding your shit on me? Wassup? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alonzo glances at a clock, it's 11:30, time's wasting. Jake follows his eye-line to the clock.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck your little rendezvous. Alonzo reacts, surprised Jake knows all.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I got your number, homie. You're worse than a gangster. They ain't hiding behind badges.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: (holds out his hands) Then hook and book me. For what? You shot Roger when you were whacked on P.C.P. and ran off like a maniac. Got witnesses? Smiley? My squad? My loyal troopers? Tell your tales. We'll tell the truth. It's not what you know, it's what you can prove. Where's your evidence, Jake?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: There's my evidence. Jake nods at the cash. THWACK! Alonzo flicks his cigarette at Jake's face. A blinding explosion of SPARKS. Alonzo dives over the bed, grabbing the war bag of cash. In a rack under the bed is a sawed-off, pump SHOTGUN. Alonzo jerks the trigger -- BOOM! -- PELLETS SIZZLE past Jake's feet as he dives out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Jake. Doing good, man. First gunfight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scrambles for the kitchen. KERCHACK -- BOOM! Dives behind the counter as FORMICA EXPLODES around him.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Know that I am surgical with this baby. Wanna closed casket? Or you want one below the belt?

dialogues.speaker: IN LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Sara's boy bolts from his hiding place. Sees Jake and runs toward him. When the child reaches the hall -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake swings his pistol on him. Alonzo swings the shotgun. Both men aiming at the terrified child, frozen in the hal Alonzo smiles, squats in the hall outside the bedroom doo and beckons his son closer.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Shhh, mijo. No llores. Ven aqui, mijo. Vente no llores. Escucha a tu papi. The child looks at Jake. A connection. Jake motions the child toward him. But the child looks to his father.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Mijo. No, es malo. Es el cucuy. Te va a pegar. El cucuy, mijo. Quiere pegarle a tu mami. Vente, papasito. (Translation: Son, he's bad. He's the boogeyman. He's going to hit your mommy and you. Come here, little man.) Jake must act. He scrambles to his feet, exposing himself BOOM! Alonzo PEPPERS the FRIDGE. POP-POP! Jake FIRES as he scoops up the boy and dives int the living room. Alonzo seizes the moment to depart, dropping the empty shotgun and disappearing into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scrambles into the bedroom, gun ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara points toward the open window. Alonzo and the money are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo flings the money on the roof, climbs the railing. And pulls himself on the roof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat later, Jake exits the window, climbs onto the railing and follows Alonzo onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo's silhouette running along the treacherous rooftop, takes cover alongside a pigeon coop covered with elaborate graffiti. Alonzo FIRES at Jake. Jake drops, rolls and FIRES back blindly. Alonzo runs for the adjacent roof. Alonzo jumps onto a balcony. Jake runs at full tilt. Toward the edge of the roof. Where nasty coils of razor-wire lay in wait. Jake jumps -- His foot hits rotten plywood -- Jake flies awkwardly through space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pigeon coop. Chairs, a card table, potted plants; a little oasis. The edge of the roof approaching fast, and its concertina of razor-wire. Jake's chest hits it -- oof! An iron spike atop a fence a mere inch from his ear. Jake pulls himself onto the roof. Smack! Alonzo nails Jake's face with the war bag of cash. Jake is stunned, Alonzo grabs the gun tied to Jake's hand and both hit the deck. They wrestle as Alonzo gets a finger in the trigger guard -- POP-POP-POP-CLICK! Emptying Jake's PISTOL. Using his gun as brass knuckles, Jake punches Alonzo's head. Alonzo head-butts Jake, knees him in the crotch. Jake gasps in agony. Alonzo stands, begins stomping Jake's head. Jake rolls out of the way. Alonzo kicking. Jake rolling... Right off the edge of the roof. Jake falls a story to -- THUD! -- a roof below. Alonzo looks down at Jake. Who looks half-dead. Alonzo looks at his watch -- he has 25 minutes. Alonzo spits on Jake and moves on. Alonzo crosses to a stairwell and disappears.  81 82 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo climbs in the G-ride and backs out. The money in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Something is falling toward the G-ride -- it's Jake, he jumped off the roof. WHAM! Jake hits hard, denting the roof. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alonzo reacts, punches the gas, whips the wheel hard. Jake rolls onto the hood. Before he smacks the street, Jake extends a hand and snags the windshield wiper. He tries to pull himself up, but the sheet metal wiper bends back on itself.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE'S FEET
dialogues.text: drag along the street. RUBBER GRINDING off his heels.

dialogues.speaker: WIPER
dialogues.text: It cuts Jake's hand, now slick with blood. Stress cracks in the sheet metal. The METAL TEARS...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The wiper snaps off. With three desperate fingers, Jake grabs the window stanchion, pulls himself back onto the windshield, his bloody face pressed against the glass, crimson streaks cascade down. Jake begins whipping Alonzo with the wiper in his left hand. Pffck! Pffck! Opens a gash on Alonzo's face as he backs down the street. Alonzo presses a button and a GUN slides out of the dash, Alonzo grabs it, presses the muzzle against the glass where Jake's face is. Jake jerks his head -- BAM! A near miss. BAM! Another hole in the glass. But fortunately not Jake's head. WHAM! The G-RIDE backs into a car. The gun flies from Alonzo's hand, out the window. Jake tumbles off the car onto the street. The G-ride stalls. It didn't get far at all. Alonzo is pretty beat up from the crash. Jake scrambles for the gun, then leans in the window of the G- ride and punches Alonzo several times. Jake grabs the war bag, pulls open the door and yanks Alonzo out onto the street, Jake backs up, sets the war bag at his feet. The porch lights of two houses come on. Steel doors open. People tentatively step outside. Women and children, mothers with babies on their hips. Blue-collar fathers in shop uniforms. The Old Woman appears with two pretty girls. More porch lights come on. A dozen gangsters boil out of a driveway like angry hornets. Lead by the imposing Bench Presser. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gangsters encircle the G-ride. Alonzo stands, faces Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No fun when the rabbit has the gun, is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Someone dome this white boy right now. Jake casts wary sideways glances. The Bench Presser smirks, holds back his people with massive arms.

dialogues.speaker: BENCH PRESSER
dialogues.text: Police business. Alonzo shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: First head that drops this fool is gonna be a rich man! To Alonzo's astonishment, no one moves. He's on his own. Jake's eyes are cooler and blacker than a shark's, pistol at his side.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: They're not like you. Know what I learned today? I'm not like you.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Good. Now what? Gonna kill me? Gonna break your cherry with a cop? Ever done a little killin', Jake? Just stepped on some ants? Ain't easy. Do it clean, right here, Jake. Alonzo taps his forehead as he takes a step toward Jake.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: ‘Cause if I live, I'll be up in Santa Clarita, taking care of that gal I talked to this morning. Sweet voice. She's Chicana, light-skinned. Like to know how a good woman like that feels on the inside. Jake smolders. He aims at Alonzo. Right between the eyes. No. He can't. Jake lowers the gun. Alonzo laughs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jake realizes Alonzo is stark raving mad. And it's kind of funny. Alonzo sees he isn't getting anywhere. Alonzo turns to the G's.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: C'mon. Someone dump this man. A gun is tossed at Alonzo's feet. A tired old workhorse. Drilled-out numbers, taped-up grips.

dialogues.speaker: BENCH PRESSER
dialogues.text: Put in your own damn work. Jake and Alonzo looking at the gun. Alonzo smiles. He slowly reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Don't do it. Alonzo turns his back, steps closer to the gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Wait, shoot me in the back. Guarantee yourself the gas chamber. Know it smells like pine oil? Alonzo reaching for that gun. BAM! Jake SHOOTS Alonzo in the upper thigh. Alonzo growls, taking the pain. He hops on one leg.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Sonufabitch. You shot me in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Next one kills you. Jake grabs the war bag. Loose bills fall around Alonzo. He desperately scrapes them off the street.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Gimme the money, Jake. C'mon, son.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Oh, now you dirty? Straight jackin' me, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Told you. It's my evidence. My proof. Wanna go to jail. Or you wanna go home? Jake smikes at Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It's street justice. Nothing wrong with that. Right? Alonzo's eyes narrow in hatred. Alonzo rages at the gangsters.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Disloyal fool-ass bitch-made punks! Put cases on all y'all! Whole crew's going to Folsom. Solitary for life. No human contact. Fuck y'all. Alonzo looks diminished, broken. Jake's eyes fall to the badge around Alonzo's neck. He smirks at the irony. Then yanks the badge from Alonzo's neck.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You don't deserve this. Jake looks at the gangsters, their faces, the faces of the people around him. He sees satisfaction. Hears murmurs of approval. Jake meets the Bench Presser's gaze, who leans against the G-ride. Pulls a beer from his pocket and cracks it.

dialogues.speaker: BENCH PRESSER
dialogues.text: Better get on outta here. The Bench Presser gives Jake a slight nod of respect and Jake leaves. Alonzo watches Jake go in outraged amazement Alonzo moves to follow Jake and gets the Bench Presser's gun in his face. The crowd surrounding the G-ride drifts away. People return home.

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: That's right. That's right. I'll burn this down. Take it all down. Walk away. See what happens. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No one listens. Alonzo has been abandoned save for the gangsters guarding him. He despairs in his defeat.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: walking away, the money in hand, his innocence gone. Though there is a heavy burden on his shoulders, there is much strength in his gait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-ride barrels west toward LAX. A 747 in the landing pattern overtakes it, its ENGINES HOWL as it descends.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 84
dialogues.text: Alonzo tears open the head liner, exposing a Glock duct- taped inside the roof. He lays the weapon on the seat next to him, where a ROVER plays routine POLICE CHATTER. Alonzo tears back the head liner more, finds a manila envelope, dumps it on the seat -- there's plane tickets, cash, pesos, passports, travelers' checks, IDs, apartment keys. His getaway kit. A red light ahead. Light cross traffic. Alonzo notes headlights following him. Stops at the light. He takes a pull on a pint of vodka. Wipes his lips with a shaky hand. A van pulls into the intersection to make a left. Too far into the intersection. Alonzo eyes it, wary. The headlights pull up behind him -- another VAN -- SCREECHING to a stop at an angle, blocking him. The side doors on both vans slide open. Gun steel glimmers. This is it. It's going down. Alonzo reaches for his Glock. Hesitates. It's over. Alonzo lifts his chin and braces for what is coming... BRRRDDDDDDDT! Two men in each van open FIRE with heavy AUTOMATIC WEAPONS -- AKs and HK-9ls. Muzzle flashes strobe across bandanna-covered faces and shiny eyes. These pros know their weapons. BULLETS PUNCH into Alonzo, the G-Ride. Passing straight through the car, SHATTERING GLASS. Shattering Alonzo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: After forever, the weapons are empty. Gun smoke wafts through the intersection. Alonzo, his beloved G-ride, are shredded. Alonzo leans forward, his head hits the HORN. The DOORS of the vans SNAP SHUT. The vans take off in different directions. FOOM! A small FIRE STARTS under the G-ride, leaking fuel and fluids. The flames spread, the interior burns.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERS OF FIRE
dialogues.text: as they probe out from the bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 85
dialogues.text: Jake slowly approaches his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his driveway is a plush unmarked police sedan.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jake grabs his service nine from his duffle. He parks and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake shoves the nine in his waistband and crosses to the sedan. Lou, Doug and Stan exit the car. They've been waiting.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Where's the money, Jake?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The evidence room at headquarters. Jake slaps Alonzo's badge on the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: That's not necessary. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: That's not mine. Doug picks up Alonzo's badge, impressed, pockets it. Before Doug can say anything.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Now leave me the hell alone. With the last of his strength, a battered and mauled Jake limps away. The three wise men climb in their car. The plush sedan backs out of Jake's driveway. Jake enters his house. PULL BACK. Jake's home becomes indistinguishable in a sea of houses.
